sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>king</radical>'s <radical>hat</radical>, not to mention the <radical>hair</radical> stuck to said hat, is incredibly <kanji>rare</kanji>. If you have your hands on either of these things, you'll be a rich duck.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself holding a king's hat covered in his hair. Who will you sell it to? This is such a rare item!
readingMnemonic: Then you look closer at the hat. It's about to get even <kanji>rare</kanji>r. Attached to the hair is the king's <reading>chin</reading> (<ja>ちん</ja>).
readingInfo: Not sure how it got there, but you'll make a pretty penny from this. The king only had one chin, so that's about as <kanji>rare</kanji> as they come.
